adjective.description: Relating to the instincts, physiological processes, and activities connected with physical attraction or intimate physical contact between individuals.
examples: she had felt the thrill of a sexual attraction

adjective.description: Relating to the two sexes or to gender.
Being of one sex or the other; capable of sexual reproduction.
examples: the asexual winged forms lay the eggs which hatch into the sexual form

adjective.description: (of reproduction) involving the fusion of gametes.

origin: Mid 17th century: from late Latin sexualis, from Latin sexus sex.
